class_notes:
QTM 110 is prerequisite.


A variety of disciplines conduct research using human subjects, whether through surveys and polling, focus groups, field observation, or clinical trials. By reviewing historical cases of controversial human subjects research as well as the national and international standards for ethical conduct that such controversies inspired, students will be prepared to face the challenges of designing effective and ethical studies. By the end of the course, students will have hands-on survey design practice, experience IRB-style protocol review and revision, and apply the ethical principles that govern human subjects research to current issues of human artifacts and data privacy.
course_description: Special Topics Courses. Includes Game Theory I/II, Maximum Likelihood Estimation, Longitudinal Data Analysis, Experimental Methods, Survey Research Methods, Computational Modeling, and Advanced Topics: Bayesian Statistics.
schedule_location: TTh 2:30pm-3:45pm in Math & Science Center - N304
